name: RallyX
description:
This is a game inspired by the classic Rally-X arcade game, but programmed in Micro Color BASIC for TRS-80 MC-10. It also uses a machine-language subroutine made by Darren Atkinson to refresh the entire background from array of strings in the BASIC program. Thanks to Greg Dionne for his insights into keyboard polling to allow for smooth non-stop input.

Just in case you can't read the characters in the chunky Semigraphics-6 font of the MC-10, the controls are WASD. The pixel resolution of the screen is 64 X 48, and there is not provision for regular text being displayed.  So unfortunately, the letters and numbers have to be rendered in the blocky pixels.  It takes a little getting used to, but with a little time you will be recognizing the letters and numbers in their glorious 3X3 font.  It's just one of the limitations we users of this quirky 8-bit micro are used to.
